description:
To the tune of "Where Everybody Knows Your Name" from Cheers.

Struggling your way to work today takes everything you've got.
Shutting off the phone from texts and emails would be like hitting the jackpot. 

Wouldn't it be nice to get off the grid?

All these deadlines and reports, just make them go away.
And your coworker threw you under the bus on a Monday.

Of course the word for that is betray!

Sometimes you wanna go..

Where you can order a soy latte
And a side of fresh baguette. 
You wanna be where you can hide,
From a place that your'e not spied. 
You wanna be where nobody knows your'e there.

You get to the caf, the coffee is bad, the morning's looking bleak
And phone messages to answer, you counted fifty six.

And everyone is calling off sick!

Be glad there's one place in the hood

Where you can order a cold brew
And perhaps a milk cashew. 
You wanna be where you can hide,
From a place that your'e not spied. 
You wanna be where nobody knows your'e there.

Where the Wi-Fi is always free.
And an option of Matcha Gren Tea.
___________________
OK, I'm not expecting a Tony Award for this masterpiece, but I do expect to get my caffeine fix from this place. Yup, this is my getaway place away from work when I want to relieve some stress and to meet up with some colleagues to vent. 

The only thing missing from this place is a restroom, which they used to have in the corner, but they turned it into an office. Maybe they did that so that the homeless won't have to keep bothering them. 

I don't care. It's close to work and the coffee is always good.
author: John G.

description:
Came here for a quick coffee and breakfast before I got on with my business for the day.

wasn't too crowded at all around 10 am, was able to order right away. Got a cold brew and an apple.

Cold brew was actually pretty decent, came out rather quickly. picked up an apple from the fridge but it didn't feel like it was super fresh - could squish it a little bit.

Nothing to complain about but nothing to write home about either. Nice that Peet's was a quick and good option when every single starbucks was filled with busy commuters
author: Daniel Z.

description: Solid coffee place -- quick, efficient service with strong, great tasting coffee. A few tables and chairs inside and some outside as well. I ordered a white mocha latte which wasn't sickeningly sweet the way some shops make it. Overall, it is a chain shop and nothing super special, so wouldn't go out of my way to stop by. But I'd visit again if I happen to be in the area.
author: Nika B.

description: Why does peets hire unhappy people. I will never know. Maybe thats all they can find for a coffee shop but you would think they would at least be friendly for tips. but I am sorry to report NO.
author: David A.

description:
Since we had somewhat of a skeleton crew on Friday, October 13th, our boss offered to buy us an afternoon treat of coffee and dessert. A few of my coworkers headed over to Peet's and grabbed our drinks and snacks around 2:15pm.

I ordered a Triple Caffè Macchiato and an Iced Lemon Curd Scone. The coffee was strong which i liked, but the size didn't seem to reflect a triple shot as the cup was very small. I feel like they gave me a double instead of a triple. I wanted something tart, so I figured the lemon scone would do. It ended up being a little dry. I found myself wishing I had clotted cream to give it more moisture.

I have been to this location a few times to grab coffee for takeout. It's your average size. I normally go around 10am, so it's never been super packed or busy when I've been there.

I do enjoy Peet's coffee over another coffee chain that has a particular green logo. I just wish the triple espresso was the size of a triple. Made me feel a little shorted.
author: Elena N.

description:
I was excited to vacation in California so that I could visit a Peet's Coffee. Here in Florida they only sell Peet's k-cups and I quickly became a fan of their coffee. 

On my first visit I tried a mocha latte with an extra shot and loved it. On my second visit and every visit after that I ordered the  Golden Latte. It is made with turmeric, ginger and honey and is beyond delicious. Every day since my vacation ended I have wished that I could get my hands on a Golden Latte. 

I also tried a few of their bakery items. I was not overly impressed. No matter what day or time of day I thought that baked goods were dry and uneventful.
author: Laura G.

description: I came here because I really needed to use the restroom and was purchasing a cup of coffee and needed to kill some time for a bit.  I purchased my coffee and asked to use the restroom and they said they didn't have one. I think the person who said they didn't have one felt somewhat bad and then another employee chimed in and I said, so what do you guys do and he said we walk to Target.  Have you ever heard of such a thing! Can you say illegal.  I doubt Peet's would put them in that predicament.  So rude and he must of thought I was an idiot.
author: Michelle C.

description:
I had a Bogo coupon and since it's near SFMOMA we went here. 

Since we had a big lunch we were full, so I got 2 cappucino, less milk to try to stay awake.

It's about $3.50 for a small and since I had a Bogo coupon it was 2 for $3.50!  Charged it.

We sat outside next to a smoker, but I moved to another seat, smoke probably still moved to my side but I didn't notice it as much.
author: Ann L.

description: Interesting now coffee shops don't even have a restroom?! How could the city even give them Permites to operate and have a store?
author: Ali N.

description: Went in to grab a quick cappuccino and they were super busy. Felt like they rushed my drink and wasn't that good.  This was a quick stop but next time would like to try their brewed coffee to get a better feel of how their menu items are. Ambience felt good and a nice place to hang out.
author: Kiran S.

description: Their shift lead Clyde is worthless and has no concept of customer service, problem solving, or dedication to the brand he represents. I will never go to this Peets again.
author: Henry K.

description:
Very small facility, but polite staff and a good variety of coffees, tees and cold versions of said. Not too many cold drinks though. A few but extremely tasty biscuits and cookies. 

Had no problem to seat my 5 people family.
author: Karin H.

description:
I am a big fan of their salad. Yeah, it's refrigerated and it's not something freshly made. However, it still tastes so good. I forgot the name of the salad I got, but it had kale, pea, raspberry and a lot of other stuff. I am on a cutting diet, so I did not put in any salad dressing at all. However, the salad itself still tastes so good. It was juicy (thanks to the raspberry), and fulfilling. I did not need to eat anything else after eating this. 

I guess I will come back more to get work done and for a healthy meal.
author: Lila L.

description:
This Peet's location has been a regular morning stop for me for many years now during my frequent visits to SF.  

Depending on how I'm feeling, I tend to alternate my OOTD (Order of the Day) between two drinks:  a Dirty Chai made with Almond Milk (aka "a dirty almond chai" in Peet's barista terms) or an Americano with steamed Almond Milk.  

The employees here are consistently pretty friendly and if there's a line, it moves fast.  Lately, they've gotten a little lazy with my Americano order and a couple of times now, they've just handed me over the almond milk (not steamed) to pour in myself.  I'll have to call them out on that if they do it again ;)  

Even with cold instead of steamed almond milk in my americano, I'm grateful to Peet's for giving me my morning caffeine and will continue to be a regular on future visits!

Additional note: My Yelp Check-In # for this place is likely way off as I hit up Peet's so early (and without having had my coffee yet), that I don't check-in 90% of the time ;)  Trust me though... I've been here probably 100+ times!  

Thanks Peet's!
author: Gabi M.

description: Peet's coffee is not that great in my opinion. I prefer Starbucks. I visit Peet's when it's most convenient.
author: Shenna J.

description:
Is this like the Starbucks of San Francisco? Sorry if I offended anyone...hi, tourist here. But I meant it in a good way. I love Starbucks. I just saw a lot of Peet's here in SF.

All jokes aside....Peet's Coffee & Tea is REALLY GOOD. Very pleased with their drink selections and pastries. We came here on a Tuesday morning (around 9am) for coffee + breakfast and their was a line out the door. Boyfriend ordered a regular hot coffee with an almond pastry and I got a hot coconut crème latte with a ham and cheese croissant sandwich. To me, they one-up'd Starbucks on this one. I think their coconut drinks are new and that was an excellent idea with their marketing team. Perfect timing for summer too. My drink was perfect. It had the right amount of espresso and hints of coconut. Not too sweet but you can tell it's a coffee drink.

Coffee was delicious and hot. My breakfast sandwich was good too.
author: Cynthia L.

description: Terribly slow even with 5 people working and latte only 2/3 full. Took 3 separate steam milk and came out like warm.
author: Mark G.

description: I'm generally a fan of Peet's but I've been to this location a few items where I had to leave because the line was just too long and didn't moved.  I think increasing the staff by one or two people during peak times could really do a lot!  Quite a few Starbucks in the neighborhood where I can do the mobile order and pick it up on my timing.  Would love to come back here with shorter wait times.
author: Rose Z.

description:
Ever appreciate when a shop is just big enough to service everyone who comes through it efficiently? That's this Peet's. It's very small, and though there are a few tables along the window, it's not really a place you want to sit and work or relax. However:

1. The staff is friendly and always attentive
2. The coffee is Peet's (not saying it's anything amazing, but it gets the job done in the way you expect).

I used to go in an out of here every single day when it was close to my office, and I'll occasionally come back here anyway, even though we've moved a bit farther away, because the service is so quick.

Another upside is that they're one of the only Peet's I've seen that isn't out of lemon curd scones at 10am.
author: Noah G.

description:
Peet's seems to be way more popular than Starbucks over in San Francisco. I got my standard cup of black coffee. I wanted a blonde roast, but the barista told me Peet's only does bolder dark roasts. I settled for it and found it to be satisfactory.

Also tried their maple syrup javiva. It's like a frappucino, just a slightly different consistency. I wouldn't say Peet's is better than Starbucks, just different. It's just a matter of taste.
author: Nick C.

description: Great place to grab a quick joe and enjoy nice relaxing music, not too loud and not too quiet either. Their music volume is like the Goldilocks of sound .  Quick service, a pleasant addition!
author: Curtis F.

description:
Friendly service and consistently solid lattes makes this place my go-to coffee spot before work. I get my coffee fix before 7 in the morning so there's never a crowd. I don't know how they are when it gets busy though.

They have a bunch of options for latte flavors! I'm on a mission to try them all. So far I've had the Cinnamon Bun and Brown Butter Shortbread lattes. Both were delicious! 

[TIP] Check in on yelp to knock off $1 from your total! This makes the latte basically one of the cheapest in the area!
author: Lucy N.

description: Only my second Pete's experience- likely the last. Decent coffee with questionable customer experience two mornings in a row with the food - insane wait without explanation. Not busy either time and straight off the menu. It's no wonder Starbucks dominates this space...
author: Lance R.

description: This is my first time at Peete's. I ordered a Mocha Javiva, aka: "Mocha Frappe". I'll give this Peete's drink 3 stars, compared to Starbucks 4 stars and Dutch Bros 5 stars. I'm not a regular hot coffee drinker, I only drink these cold blended sweet drinks and nothing else.
author: Doug B.

description: Peet's never disappoints! Order a small in a medium cup so you don't have to sacrifice any coffee. It's a cheaper medium size!
author: Jenevieve A.

description:
Hooray! Peet's now offers ALMOND MILK LATTES. Currently you can CHECK-IN ON YELP and get $1 off any vanilla latte. If you opt in for Peet's electronic newsletters, you also frequently receive coupons via email. I recently got one for $2 off any size soy/almond milk vanilla latte and decided to give it a try. Delicious! The nutty flavor of almond milk goes really well with the vanilla, and I don't feel that extra sweet flavor that I taste in soy milk. 

I like this particular location because it's right by my office. For some reason it doesn't get ridiculously crowded in mornings unlike Starbucks around the corner. If I need a breather from working at my cube, I often walk down for a quick break. There's also a few tables available if you want to eat lunch here too (usually I grab a bahn mi sandwich from Tart to Tart and come eat at Peet's). Additionally, there is no overwhelming background music if you want to do some work at this location--just the hum of espresso machines.

Tips:
+ Check-in via Yelp for a discount
+ Subscribe to online newsletter for more coupons/discounts
+ Try the almond milk vanilla latte

Things to note:
- Peet's tends to have a lower temp on drinks compared to Starbucks. Just ask them to make it extra hot if you prefer it.
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
It was late in the day, a few days before X-Mas so I decided to treat my fellow co-workers out to coffee since we were working late.

They all like strong coffee, so like a good waiter, I took their order and delivered their coffee to them at work.

Coming back, this beautiful woman opened the lobby door for me. I thanked her, and felt sheepish that I couldn't juggle the tray of coffee and door.

Ironically, the woman happened to work on my floor, and since we're siloed in our own cubicles, I never noticed her before since she sits on the opposite side of the floor.

Ironically, she too has blue eyes, but her name is Kim.

The coffee seemed way too strong, and the sea salt mocha just tasted like chunks of salt, which was gross.

So, as much as I would love to go out with Kim, it turns out she's married with children. Yikes! 

It was a nice daydream while it lasted though, even though the daydream lasted all of 10 minutes, LOL.

Here's hoping the New Year will bring a better job and someone special to share this life with,
author: Jack R.

description:
If I could give this Peet's more stars I would!
Every time I go to this location I get nothing but friendly service and great Peet's coffee. This location also has Maple syrup which I always get as a Maple Mocha. I wish this location was bigger but oh well.
Thanks to the staff for being so great!
author: David George J.

description: This is the only Peet's in the financial district that's open on weekends. The service is amazing! Everyone is friendly and super nice. Best part is that they allow dogs inside (not an official policy but they just smile and look the other way). I hate leaving my dogs outside especially on a cold day so I just love this particular Peets's location!
author: Ratika N.

description:
Having been to San Francisco twice before and missed out on Peet's, I made it a priority this visit!  This location is super close to the convention center so perfect for a quick coffee break if you are stuck in conferences all day. 

Any place that has my fave drink (dirty chai) on their menu receives a star in my book. I was about to order it until I saw that check in offer for a $1 off any holiday drink. Obviously can't miss a chance to save $$ so I ordered the salted caramel macchiato. Yum! Delicious drink and helped me get through the rest of my day.
author: Vaish P.

description:
The staff was okay. As a first timer, I asked for their recommendation and he gave me a blank look.  After I ordered, they were like a machine in progress. I decided to try the caramel macchiato.  At first, it was slightly bitter, but, tasted great at the end.  It wasn't quite as hot as I excepted, like Starbucks tried to burn your taste buds.  I also got a chocolate croissant. I wouldn't recommend it. Basically a candy bar backed in bread.  

I will give it another chance - but not quite 5 stars for me.
author: John A.

description: Peet's is one of my favorite coffee places. Personally, it is way better than Starbucks and I just don't understand why there aren't more of these.  This one is on my way to work so I go here often to get my latte fix.  Small store, but the staff is consistently polite.  My only pet peeve is 85% of the time I have to ask them to put simple syrup out.  Also, it has gotten so expensive here and I certainly hope prices don't go up.  Other than that, I am a fan!
author: Megan M.

description: Sunday morning 9:30 . The waiting line was long , reaching the door .  So I went to the chairs at the back and opened my iPad .  An African-American male barista came all the way from the counter to me and said I had to leave .  I had never seen him before,  and I was stunned .  I told him I was waiting for the line  to get shorter and then I will get a reward from my app.  He told me to leave two more times .  I repeated the same response .  Then he said my music was too Loud.  But  my church music was not even audible from the counter . When the line were  shortened to 3 people,  I ordered my  caramell macchiato.  I told the  caucasian  female assistant manager the harassment, and she said there were no empty seats .  Strange . there was an unoccupied chair right in front of me .  The beverage she produced had no caramel.  Then she pumped some into my drink , but she did not stir it.  And it was bitter . I never had a worse c.m. in my entire  life .  Then a bum walked in , sat right in front  of me and begged for change .  Then he moved to the  very front of the cafe.  Then he returned to the chair in front of me and plugged his charger .  All these minutes , he consumed  no Peet's  products .  So I asked this assistant manager why this bum  was not requested to leave . she said he will be .  I left in shock.
author: Sun S.

description:
This place got a new manager recently and several new employees and it spiraled down the toilet as far as any customer service goes, e.g. over charging and not listening when you bring this to their attention, i.e. "Look at the price on the board above your head".

I now walk several extra blocks to go to the Peet's next door to Roy's on Mission
author: Harold F.

description: I want to start this off by saying I love Peet's. I live in orange county and exclusively go to Peet's in my area. My fiancé and I were visiting San Francisco and came to this location and were treated very poorly. The staff was very cold and seemed bothered to help us. They got both of our drinks wrong and charged us for things we didn't receive.
author: Tony T.

description:
This location never fails to make an inferior drink than the Peet's by Yerba Buena. It's difficult to pin down exactly what they do wrong but my lattes tend to taste better at other Peet's locations. To be more precise, flavored drinks or sweetened drinks tend to be overdone when I ask for "lightly sweetened" or taste completely bland and watered down. Yet they taste great when I order the same elsewhere.

I contribute this lack of quality to the fact that this location is not as attentive because they get busy. Also, the fact that there is almost always someone in line, no matter what time of day, makes this a less appealing location for me.
author: Nina M.

description: Fast even with long line from convention nearby. Had a few bagels but -1 for no toaster, pretty easy to add one.
author: Andrew M.

description: I ordered a brewed decaf coffee from JC around 6:30 in the evening. He served me what was left, but offered to brew a fresh supply.  I was very happy he would do this. Starbucks won't brew decaf for folks late in the day. JC made this customer very happy today. Jordan was also very kind and professional. Thank you guys. It's hard to get decaf in San Francisco at coffee shops. I'll keep my money coming here as long as you keep offering brewed decaf (as an alternative to Decaf Americanos which DO NOT taste the same) to your customers.  A wonderful experience!
author: Eli S.

description:
Great customer service!  The employees here seem to enjoy working here and with each other.  Happy vibe, love it!  Rainbow colored hair guy served me with big smiles, joyful energy, awesome and brightened my day even more!!  Keep up the great energy everyone at this Peet's Coffee & Tea store!!

p.s.  I was at a Starbucks store at Brannan & 4th yesterday.  I received no eye contact, no greetings, no smile nor any welcoming customer service at all from the two Starbucks employees working at that location at the time.  Disappointing experience.
author: Gina W.

description: Iced coffee was alright but the almond croissant I got was pretty terrible. It was dense and slightly hard to rip.
author: Diana L.

description: Quick and efficient location. The staff is always nice and courteous and moves you right along.
author: David B.

description: Peet's is my favorite place for the richest, darkest, black ice tea but when it comes to their customer service, the bomb dropped on them.  They need better appearance people, plus they tend to chat too much about personal their lives.  I figure it's a young person's job and it doesn't mean a whole lot going to school and everything, but this is real work experience even if it does not pan out into a serious career.
author: BanBan B.

description: Pumpkin chai latte wasn't good, tasted like fake pumpkin, not sure how to explain it. But their dark chocolate pumpkin was really good. And their chocolate chip cookies were good too. I'd recommend this place.
author: Adri M.

description: This is my favorite spot for coffee. The staff are always happy and friendly no matter what time I visit this place. I like the variety of drinks they have here.
author: Ross P.

description: Loved my drink! Ordered the Black Tie because my sisters wanted coffee, I wasn't going to get anything but after a sip of my sisters drink I had to order one.
author: Candice K.

description:
Thank The Lord for Peets Coffee to save me from the watered down mess that is Starbucks.

This particular location's brew is as consistently good as the many others around the Bay Area and the service was fast and efficient, even during morning rush hour.
author: Stephen J.

description: Worst coffee I ever had It went straight to the garbage, I asked for decaf coffee and I got coffee bean extract just waste of my money and my time I spend on line waiting
author: Dina M.

description: Love this place.  Gave it one less start because sometimes the wait is too long in the morning or afternoon.
author: Tracy Q.

description:
Peet's on Mission and I...we go way back. 

On my first day at a new job (in 2008), I was standing in line anxiously among new colleagues...waiting to order. I approached the counter and before even uttering a word the kind gentleman behind the counter said "Wow, your hair looks really great today!" Took the edge off, gave me a mini boost (so did the coffee, of course)...and I truly never really forgot that day. I've been back to Peet's probably 50x since. 

Usually a medium Americano...sometimes I pick up an oatmeal to go to avoid the basket of pastries that are usually looming at our office. An iced drink in the afternoon. Whatever the mood, Peet's has the "pick-me-up." 

I'll never forget you kind counter boy...4+ years later I'm still working at the company, and I still frequent Peet's :)
author: Colleen C.

description:
This is the ultimate in utilitarian coffee shops... fast, friendly service, strong coffee, but not the kind of place you want to hang out and read the Sunday Times. There's just not a lot of space inside, and although they should be commended for providing outdoor seating, it's not exactly pleasant to sip your latte while traffic whizzes by on 3rd St.

It's Peet's, so the coffee is strong and reliably good. The staff seems well-managed. It's just painfully small.
author: Andrew M.

description:
This Peet's is functional, but nothing more. The space is super-cramped. I couldn't imagine sitting down in one of the few tables available by the windows, people must constantly brush by on the way to the counter.

But, if you're a Peet's geek you'll get your fix here, no problem.
author: Bill H.

description:
Both the warmth of the shop and the people who worked there made this a great place to a grab a coffee or quick breakfast while I was visiting SF. 

The coffee wasn't amazing by Australian standards, but the free WiFi and delicious berry scones made up for it!
author: Laura D.

description: This location is fast and friendly.  I love Peet's coffee and I'm glad that this one is near my work.
author: Amanda K.

description:
No rest room here, just rear office door. Many disappointed and gyrating below the belt and crossing their legs until they can find relief. They can go next door to the Grove. 

This Peet's is busy, but small, with only a few tables. Order your java, and then keep walking. Gyrating or not. 

Staff is friendly, coffee better than Starbux.
author: Wanugee N.

description:
I came here every day for a week while I was staying at the nearby W hotel. Though I hear Blue Bottle is down the street and I could have tried another coffee place the service at Peet's and its convenience kept me coming back for more. I got the same morning pick me up everyday - a medium coffee with a shot of espresso. I like my morning jolt. Everyday the guy/gal at taking my order would smile, wish me good morning and tell me to have a wonderful day. Why thank you for that morning welcome.

Every day, the wonderful guy doing the espresso would smile that handsome smile of his and some days would ask if I wanted another shot and even warmed milk in my coffee gratis. Well, don't mind if I do. Clearly, good manners and smiles go a long way on both sides of this business transaction. 

The coffee is strong. So strong that by the time I got 1/2 to 3/4 way done with the beverage I would have to throw it away as it was just too dark, too bold and too bitter. I didn't see too much of a problem by this because by then I was caffeinated and it was all good. I look forward to my return next year to see those lovely faces at Peet's.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
I have been stopping by this location to get coffee in the morning on my way to work. Well, not really on the way but I make extra steps for it because of the following:

 consistency of the quality of drinks. Most of them make decent espresso drinks, most of them. I know if I will like my drink once I see the Barista. 
 friendly service -- yes, certain employee(s) here can be chatty but most of them has the perfect amount of it but not too much.
 surveys -- once a while, you will get a survey invite after your order. You can tell they are taking the feedback s seriously because you can see some of the improvement if not all 
 location and hours -- works for me

If there's one thing I can ask for, it will be staffing. Morning needs more staff, especially Baristas. There were days that I wanted to get espresso drinks but ended up order house coffee because I saw who the Barista was and people already in line waiting for their drinks.
author: Lianna D.

description:
Coffee shops are a lot like people: They're adorable when young and full of energy, intolerable as teenagers, and they usually die before they hit 20 years of age. When a cafe happens to survive into adulthood, it becomes something like Peet's. And once you graduate from local chain to local mega-chain, there's no turning back.

Then what happens? The baristas lose their edge and start smiling and asking customers' names. You start offering seasonal lattes and weird things called Freddos that no one really knows how to pronounce properly. You might even start selling CDs and Kind Bars. Peet's is that kind of place. It's no longer that cool, but once you throw up your first Tensa-Barrier it's game over, man. Game over.

Whatever, I'm sick of talking about this. Peet's is consistent and passable coffee that you'd have to be legally blind (or a spectre) to avoid if you're anywhere in the FiDi. Don't feel embarrassed to go there, but Blue Bottle is just as ubiquitous and superior. 

Obligatory Title Pun: For PEET'S sake, grab a cup and get outta there.

Menu Readability: Corporate. I'll vouch for the readability though.

Need to mention: Their website claims that early adherents of the brand are called "Peetniks." They also have a roast master Emeritus. What the moose?

What this place teaches me about myself: I'm the worst.
author: Vivek S.

description:
I can't believe no one mentioned The Magician!

One of the employees here liked to perform a "magic trick" when handing back your change/credit card: WHOOPS, WHERE DID IT GO?!?! HAHA SO FUNNY

This was amusing the first time or two but it seemed he couldn't help himself and would repeat this "trick" every time my colleges and I would buy coffee. EVERY. TIME. This became somewhat irritating but my colleges were too polite to complain.

Thankfully the person in question is no longer there. I'm not sure exactly what happened to him but I am glad I no longer have to endure his irritating "magic" when buying a cup of drip coffee.

So, +1 stars to Peets for dealing with bad employees.

This place is usually busy so I tend to go elsewhere for a caffeine fix.
author: Cortland T.

description:
Oops!

The barista was chatty and charming, but I think during the small talk she forgot I ordered DECAF.  I don't drink caffeine on work days and I can't have any after dinner or I get extremely restless and agitated.  Now I can't sleep and feel very uncomfortable and I have to wake up for work in 5 hours.  It's upsetting the dog.

On the bright side, somewhat literally, they make better use of space and lighting than a lot of the other peets.  And the barista did go out of her way to be friendly.  The coffee was as good as any chain.  I just wish it was decaf!
author: Nathan C.

description:
Indeed, I'm a fan and I'm proud to say why! In a nutshell, Peet's Coffee & Tea is a chain that doesn't make me cringe as I walk in the door. This is not just because the coffee is good (great, actually), nor is it because they are really efficient in here, even when it's packed. It's because you don't feel like you're selling your soul to the creepy green goddess. It's nice to know you won't be standing on a line for too long, sharing breathing space with crap coffee junkies who think it's acceptable to utter "skinny," "half caf" or heaven forbid "extra whip" as you're desperate to just get your elitist java jive on. Give me my caffeinated beverage and the rest of you can just get out of my goddamned way.

See, I'm cranky in the morning.

But the baristas at Peets are not! In fact, when you give your name to a certain male barista, he is prone to sing your name in a commonly known Christmas song. Hey, they are so good at what they do here, I don't even care. I just gaze at the vegan baked goods and try to think good, caffeinated thoughts.
author: Joi B.

description: Went to this location twice and both times everyone was very friendly and helpful. Cocoa was extremely knowledgeable and took the time to make samples of some different coffee to taste. Every location should be run like this one.
author: Nick G.

description:
If you haven't yet, you must try their anniversary blend! I've had previous incarnations of their annual coffee bean roast, but somehow, they've raised the bar on this particular varietal. 

I don't think it's available to purchase on the go, but they have French presses filled with samples currently at the counter, and you can grab a bag for home brewing if you so desire. 

You'd be a real dummy if you let the opportunity pass you by. Go... now!
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I come to this shop enough to know that they're pretty consistent with the quality of their drinks. But they were off their game today. Or maybe it was the drink itself...

I normally order espresso drinks (e.g., cafe latte, americano) but today I ordered a chai latte. Somehow it turned out to be really watery and bland. I don't know if this is wrong but I know that I had an iced chai latte from another Peet's shop a few blocks away (just yesterday), and it did not have this texture and flavor. 

I'll continue to visit this shop, but I won't be ordering their chai latte.
author: Audris K.

description: Came her twice and both times I got amazing service! Coco took the time to make us samples of different blends of coffee before we purchased a bag to make sure we knew what we liked.
author: Danni P.

description: The staff here are always energetic and happy.  They recognize faces and orders after awhile, and there is very little turnover.  Unfortunately the space is cramped as this is one of the smaller peets coffees in the city.  So the lines can extend out the door, and the late and other foofoo drink folks have to dodge through a large queue most mornings
author: Matt U.

description:
"Good morning, good morning, everybody in the news this morning, good morning!"

This is what I, along with a couple of my The Soup-watching cohorts, heard every time we went to Peet's during our stay in San Francisco. Why? Because we were actually greeted with "Good morning, good morning, good morning!" every single time we walked through the doors each day. The sentiment was genuine; the laughs we got by Ann Curry association were just a bonus. 

I was definitely a fan of Peet's coffee. It was strong, smelled and tasted great, and got me through a few very long days despite some severe jet lag. Although I didn't partake, the bakery items looked straight awesome.

My reason for only four stars? No Sweet'N Low! Fortunately, there were pink packets aplenty at our office, but had this not been the case, Peet's and I would have had problems. Otherwise, it was a solid morning option.
author: Michelle C.

description:
I could give this caffination station 4 stars just based on its convenience factor. You're right along my morning walk? Well, then. Hello!

This coming from a non-morning person (aka don't look at me or talk to me before 9am or I might burn your soul with a death stare), these people are jolly and quite loud even in the wee hours of the day. It's incredible. I never knew anyone could be that awake at 7am. But, then again, I'm a damn zombie before my coffee. Hence, my frequent stops here when I'm in San Fran. 

The service is quick and this coffee is strong. In fact, it's a little too "liquid lava" for me, which I learned quickly after having the shakes all day from one cup. But, you bet your Aunt Sally that their vanilla latte (with skim and sugar-free syrup, of course) is divine. Lighter taste, and still just as potent? Right up my alley. I've learned my drink and that's what I stick to. Well, unless it's a tea kind of day, and they've got plenty of leafy options if that's your bag. 

The moral of the story: good, strong coffee in a hurry with smiles and conveniently located. Not the best coffee I've ever had, but pretty damn tasty in my book.
author: Cara L.

description:
Been here couple times and i always order the same thing. Iced matcha latte sweetened with half n  half milk. The first time I went here there's a line on the cashier and it seems like the people who work here does not move fast enough to serve the customer better, so I decided to walk out because i was in a hurry.

Then, i decided to go back again since the matcha latte is good. The second time was perfect, the cashier was nice too.

After that, my visit to peets were always with a bad experience. I never got the perfect iced matcha latte as I ordered. Sometimes they forgot to put sweet in it. Other times they dont use half and half milk (i can tell the difference).

If I compare the time I spend the same drink with Starbucks, sorry but Starbucks has faster service and the taste was not changing.

I might go back to Peets but probably I wont go back to this store
author: Alifiana U.

description:
When I'm having a busy day - I sometimes like to pop into this Peet's for a sugar fix - and chow down on one of their low fat carrot ginger muffins. 

This location is by far one of my favorite Peet's locations in the city. There are tables and chair outside for great people watching and it's conveniently located right by the office.

My favorite aspect of this particular Peet's location- is their efficient staff. I've found all of their staff to be friendly and warm, but on certain days - they have an awesome team of guys - who will go out of their way to paint your day with genuine enthusiasm and smiles.

While running around for a work promotion today - it was such a lovely break from the day - to come into this location and unwind a little with a delicious iced soy latte and with the friendly faces behind the counter.

If you're having a rough day and need a much needed break - stop into this Peet's. 

Treat yourself to a drink or pastry. And just sit for a little and breathe.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Peet's is an Pacific northwest institution, from what I understand.

And I can see why, too: the folks are so very friendly. The coffee's pretty solid, and it's pretty cheap to boot. The location is convient, especially in proximity to our office. 

As Julio noted, the "bad line feng shui" could be a result of the space itself, but it's definitely a touch confusing. That said, I make it a point to stop by this Peet's at least once each time I'm in SF, and I'm always quite happy that I do. Four big stars!
author: Rachel F.

description:
The weekday morning crew here is incredibly chipper, even when there are faced with a mob of confused tourists and grumpy, pre-coffee folks on their way to work.

It's cramped and difficult to stand in line, wait for your coffee, and put stuff in your coffee, which covers the only 3 areas of the shop, but I still think that the people who work here, combined with sheer efficiency and reasonable consistency make it worth it!
author: Jenni S.

description: It's convenient to the Intercontinental where we always stay, so I always go. The staff isn't great, but they're not terrible either. This go around my drink was luke warm and sans whipped cream for some reason, and yet it still tastes better than their commercial competitor  I'm a Peet's fan in general, so let's be honest, I'll be back (but a hot drink with the correct topping would be an added bonus).
author: Miranda H.

description:
Peet's may be just as corporate as Starbucks, but the former wins my love. Only because they started in good ol' Berkeley. And many of their cafés have plentiful seating.

This one happens to have less seating than the other Peet's I've been to. I think it's meant to be more of a grab-n-go type of café, given its location at the super-busy corner of 3rd and Mission. Do you really want to sit down... lean back... sip on your coffee... read the paper... and watch the @$$hole drivers block the intersection at the red light? If that's your idea of café scenery, you're less of a human than you think you are.

I just zip by all that traffic and get my latté. The baristas can be a little bit inconsistent with their mixes, and put a leee-tle too much sugar in my cup. But that happens rarely. Friendly service overall, but I miss the folks that were around from fall 2009 through summer 2010. Those were some of the most laughable, amiable, chill (and cute!) baristas I've ever met.
author: Hannah H.

description:
It's been known that I love Peet's.

As far as the actually coffee shops go, this might be my favorite of all of them. First of all, it's the closest to my work (yet, still quite a walk, but worth it) and I like that they have in and outdoor seating. It's a comfortable place to sit and people watch. Or get your coffee to go and go to Yerba Buena. 

The people who work here are nice and funny too.
author: Helen D.

description:
Quick, consistent, and a little bit better than Starbucks.

Cappuccinos are 80% foam, 20% lava, so get a latte instead.

If you're in a hurry, go here. Otherwise, go to Blue Bottle.
author: Evan K.

description: Decent seasonal pumpkin latte, and I definitely would rather get my coffee from Peet's than say, the overcrowded Starbucks in this area.  There was a little bit of a wait for our drinks, but I didn't mind so much since I was meeting with a friend from school and we got to catch up on our lives since we graduated.  To make up for our wait, they did give us some free coffee cards, which was greatly appreciated, and shows their great customer service.
author: Karen W.

description:
Peete's has saved me on many a morning when nothing but the strongest tea will do. Their quick, efficient ordering and serving system gets me in and out of there in under five minutes, and the tea is actually really, really good. 

The fact that Peete's is located precisely on my way from the hotel I stay in to the office I go to is wonderful, as I don't have to go out of my way to get good tea and a decent muffin. Their pastries are pretty good, especially the cranberry bran muffin thingy. They have plenty of sweeteners to choose from at the condiment bar, and you can also purchase loose tea (my fave!) in schmancy canisters. 

Oh, and there's coffee, too :).
author: Hilary H.

description: im writing about peets in general no specific location. their staff is very down to earth not like starbucks act very stuck up like they socializig with the co workers instead of giving outstanding customer service. peet is more humble and treat people like family
author: Kaylie B.

description: This Peet's location always seems to have a spare table or two for studying, which is nice.  It's right next to The Grove too in case you need another venue to study hop.
author: Mel G.

description:
Their staff is awesome!

I called at 5pm the day before because I had an emergency need for 65 gift cards. The manager was super responsive and because they didn't have enough at the store,  sent somebody to the Mission and 2nd store to get the remainder so the order could be filled. The cards were in a nice little packet waiting for me at just the time I had asked (8:30 the next morning).

Thanks guys!
author: Eli B.

description: Best coffee I've ever had. Great staff, fast friendly service. If they would open a branch in Cleveland, I'd become a regular.
author: Nick F.

description:
coffee: 2/5
service: 4/5

Peets coffee just does not taste good. As a person who likes to have their coffee black with only sugar most of the time, I can say that Peets coffee is not good by itself. It is very acidic and taste burnt. Almost sour. I try to drink it but then end up loading it with sugar and cream to drown out the actual coffee's taste. My friend told me that they use different blends and I can ask them to make me a coffee with different type of grounds. But I am not going to do that, the baristas will hate me. And I'm not going to wait 20 mins for them to make me a special cup of coffee. On the up side, even a small cup of coffee packs alot of caffeine.  

I remember Louis C.K. saying coffee chains like starbucks have coffee where "they press the button and old lady's diarrhea comes out" (paraphrased). Peets is no different. 

BUT BUT BUT. I do enjoy their super sugary lattes with fancy syrups when i decide to splurge. Nothing like a sugar and caffeine high at the same time. It's like sugar with a hint of coffee flavor. And all that frothy foam*Homer Simpson Drool*
author: Cecile S.

description: Fast and friendly service. Small place, but worth visiting anyway. Good coffee and muffins!
author: Tanner C.

description: Get the Mayan Chocolate Mocha when it's in season (and it is right now!). Period. The MCM is unique to Peet's (I think) and tastes like Masala Chai, except that it's Masala Coffee with milk and chocolate. Can't get better! In general, I've always found Peet's to have better tasting espresso drinks compared to other chains like INSERT-YOUR-FAVORITE-CHAIN-COFFEE-STORE-HERE. This one's my go-to place when I walk in to work during weekdays. The staff's always super friendly and energetic, which lifts your spirits, especially on Monday mornings. There are definitely better cafes in the area, but Peet's is always a good and safe bet.
author: Srivatsan S.

description:
I stop in almost everyday... It's a sickness.

The staff is always amazing, and my drink is always perfect!

They keep me sane!
author: Nathan B.

description:
This Peet's wins on a few fronts: location, efficiency and friendly service. If I just need a solid latte and don't want to stick around after I've got it in my clutches, this is my go-to spot, and I know the crew is always going to manage a smile despite the endless caffeine-deprived hordes snapping orders at them.

That said, none of these things change the fact that the store itself is cramped and the drinks are predictably boring. Good luck ever finding seating to have a chat over coffee when the limited (fewer than 5) tables are almost always filled with people who have set up camp with their laptops for the foreseeable future.
author: Scott T.

description:
Way better coffee than any of the other corporate options in the area and friendly, outgoing staff make this Peet's a minor oasis in what is otherwise a wasteland of decent coffee.

Coming from Portland, let's just say that I am spoiled. If you want to wonder why, just Yelp "Stumptown" in "Portland, OR", and you'll see why. 

That said, when I stayed in the Westin catercorner across the street, I had the choice between in-room Sbux (pre-ground modular filter one-cup brew), the Coffee Bean (which seems popular but I've been successfully warned away), and Sbux streetside (and you can see from my review of that place that, well, just NO)... Peet's was really my only choice for good coffee. 

Their iced coffee is like crack, but without all the hassle of gunplay and obtaining a rock in some shady street deal a few blocks south on Market. 

Lacking any place to hang out, I have to dock a star. There are, like, 2 tables in the joint. How am I supposed to have a meeting there?! It's too bad, too, because I will support Peet's over my NW hometown's megalith starbux any day.
author: Don B.

description: Nice Peet's. Great Baristas! Bright, sunny location with indoor and outdoor seating. And they do lattes and mochas right. What else you want Mr./Ms. Conventioneer?
author: Ted R.

description:
-- Update 4/5/07

They moved the coffee fixins stand to the middle, much better!

-- Original Review

While I do enjoy having a Peet's only one block away (as opposed to 2 blocks before) I have some complaints...

1. No one understands how you're supposed to line up. I don't like having to tell caffeine starved people where to stand, that should be your job.

2. The coffee sleeves, milk, sugar, and fixins are all in the back. The back happens to be tiny cove packed with addicts in withdrawal (self-included), so you're constantly pushing your way through a jittery crowd just to get a freakin sleeve for your burning hot crack-drink.

3. There is basically no seating, the place is really too narrow for the tables and having a coffee meeting here stinks.

So with all the bad what's the good? Oh that sweet, sweet, caffeine high...bring it!
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Oh jet lag...how I just want to take you out back and punch you in the face with strong words that I will then apologize for after because I am and always will be a mild-mannered Canadian. For serious - this is me reinforcing the stereotype because in my case, it's completely true.

Luckily with Peet's just around the corner from both my hotel and my office-away-from home, I can always fake my brain/body into thinking that everything is going to be okay with a decent latté. The vanilla latté came quick, nice and hot, and maybe a little on the sweet side but it certainly did the trick.

Now maybe it's because I live surrounded by people hardened and bittered by the fact that we willingly subject ourselves to months of cold, wet and dark winters, but people just seem friendlier in San Francisco including the lovely staff behind the counter here. I hate to admit that I was legitimately caught off guard when he asked me how my day was going. Sad huh?

On my next visit they managed to brighten my moment by upgrading the customer's names when drinks were ready. There was an Americano for Crystal (pronounced as the luxury booze) and a white mocha (I think) for Brit-NAAAAAY. Loved it. I also switched my latté to half-sweet and it was perfect!

All in all, Peet's is convenient, affordable, fast and friendly - the makings of a great local coffee shop and I will definitely be back. Although maybe I should remember to shake off the winter attitude before next time.
author: Ben B.

description:
Okay so I decide to try out the peet's that I pass by when coming from the Bart.  And well you know after you drink your coffee you would probably like a Mint or Gum because after coffee breath just sucks.   

What you don't have any?    I know your not a grocery store but the Starbucks at least thinks that you might need it.  

And why for some reason their large cafe americano doesn't taste as strong as starbucks.   I'm sure the coffee itself is stronger but I'm just wondering.   

I know starbucks adds an extra shot for americano's I'm thinking that Peet's doesn't.  

1 star removal for probably strong coffee that doesn't taste strong.   I'm not even sure yet if it is strong.   But people say. 
1 star removal for no mint.
1 star removal for no gum. 

Your 8 am line wasn't that long though.     Small store and at least you don't use that electronic press a button crap.  (Which I wouldn't mind at home but I do mind at a coffee shop).    I give you a star back.
author: Homer S.

description: My teenager daughter and I stopped by this very tiny Peet's Coffee and Tea. The shop itself is small and people were nice.  We were surprised the price was more reasonable than -the other brand coffee shop- we normally go to.  My daughter ordered Iced Tea and got a pastry and it was only $6! You can't get two items for that price at our (used to be) favorite (other brand coffee shop).  Lol. I think we just found ourselves a new favorite coffee shop. I haven't try their coffee drinks yet but will soon!
author: Jennifer R.

description: Although the more I learn about coffee, the less impressed I am with the large chains like Peet's and Starbuck's, I'm still overall pleased with the coffee here.  Unlike Starbuck's, the coffee is consistently good (not great, but never bad), and I LOVE the Freddos, especially after I add more extra-strength coffee.  This particular Peet's has a great service, and is nicely located near Yerba Buena park, perfect for enjoying coffee in the sun.
author: Greg B.

description:
The first time I ever came here was the first morning of my new job. I stated my drink order and gave the cashier my name and when he repeated it, the other employees literally started singing it. Who doesn't like to hear their name in song on a Monday morning? That was great and I knew that I would like coming here from that very moment. 

A few months later and I still come here almost every morning and I look forward to seeing those 3 employees (Hi Miguel, Geo and Mikey!!!) every time. They are friendly, always remember what I like to drink, even to the point where they know to serve me an iced vanilla latte on hotter days, because those are the only days I'll drink an iced drink. I don't even have to remind them. They just know. This is awesome. 

This place does get extremely crowded during convention season, but don't let the line snaking out the door fool you because the people here pump out drinks faster than the Octomom pushed out all those babies. Yes sir.
author: Jen D.

description: Large drip with caramel hold the sugar room for cream. Just a little room.
author: Jamal C.

description:
The servers at this Peet's are very friendly and the location is convenient, so I am here pretty regularly.

I'm rounding down though because the space is just too small for a decent  drink-in location (if you make the mistake of trying to sit, you'll have someone's butt on your table within about 2 minutes) and they have no bathrooms -- a personal pet peeve of mine.
author: Geoff D.

description:
I am a SB slut!  

No getting around it!

"Venti Latte, whole milk please."

I don't do all the mirade of other choices that folks stand in line at coffee houses trying to make up their mind about. I just do one thing.

Latte, whole milk.  

And, yes, size does matter.

Largest you have.

One of my good friends swears by Peets!

So . . . . to keep her quiet . . . I promised to try them . . . once again.
I went to this new one on the corner of 3rd & Mission.
Yes, it was drinkable.  But it didn't give me that "MMMM, OOOOO"  feeling that SB VL, whole milk please does.  

Not even close.

It wasn't bad, just not great.  Three stars is all I can give it.

Extra star for the little sign-up sheet for their email news.  I'm trading a few weeks of their advertising for a free drink on Peets.

When I get the drink coupon I will give it to the Peets lover . . . on my way to SB for my regular - - 

"VENTI LATTE, WHOLE MILK PLEASE!"
author: Rachel C.

description:
All of my Peet's reviews are about the "autre" -- the coffee itself incites tears of joy and is totally consistent across locations.

THIS Peet's is one of my favorites because it's got ample space for natural light to illuminate your electronic devices powered by plenty of outlets. SIt on a stool and watch the Mission passersby while you 'work.' Or better yet, go next door to the Atrium, a totally therapeutic, open space place to hang out, chat, work, zone....all while chugging down that latte of course.
author: Diane B.

description:
What can I say about Peet's? In the Starbucks vs. Peet's battle, I'm definitely in the Peet's camp. There are several Peet's between the BART station and my work, but if I'm wanting to stop for a morning coffee, this is usually the one I go to. The staff is always friendly and the coffee is consistently good. I've never had a problem getting fresh decaf here, and the iced Americanos are awesome, too. Also, over the weekend, when my bestie came for a visit from Houston, we stopped in and she got her favorite: a large mocha frapp. I asked her if it was as good as she remembered -- her last trip to California was a year-and-a-half ago, and she said yes, which means it was awesome in my book. 

The Verdict: Tasty coffee and top-knotch service.
author: Cara S.

description: What can I say other than I love Peet's.  I went to this location because my usual spot was out of most of it's whole bean decaf coffee's.  The staff was very friendly.  I had called before to see if they had the coffee in stock and one of the girls remembered talking to me on the phone.  It took a while for the other one working there to find the right coffee (I think she may have been new), but they got everything packaged up and we were on our way with a complimentary cup of coffee to enjoy on the walk home.  A few of the other reviewers mentioned outdoor seating and maybe they didn't have it out because it was raining the day I went.  I may have to come back here with the dog.
author: Scott L.

description:
This Peet's location is my favorite and by far the most easy to access when attending events near the Moscone Center. My all time favorite to cool down is their Lite Caffe Freddo Extra Bold but also ask to add in the the ground coffee beans which are omitted normally from the "lite" versions.  It's a great way to reduce the calories without reducing the flavor.  

As always, the staff has been uber friendly, efficient and prompt and since this location is so small, as in trapped on a corner, that helps move people through quickly. Cheers.
author: G M.

description:
On hot SF summers I  settle for one of the many freddos that I consider chocolate slurpies! On chilly SF days/nights my preference is their raspberry mocha. Conveniently located next to my art school, it's also a place a drop by to get a pick me up before an evening class.

Great service, great coffee, great location, great everything.
author: Andrew S.

description: Peet's is my favorite coffee in the world an fairly no existant in Austin. Theyy have recentnty started carrying it in Randals in pre packaged bags. There service and brew at this one is stellar. Unforrtuntly I am writing this atthe Starbucks downtheblock where the wireless works better.
author: Catherine D.

description: No bathroom! Uhhh how can you sell diuretics and not have bathroom! Another thing that made me kind of angry was that refills are a little expensive $1. I do like that soy milk is free and that if you buy a product you get a cup of tea or coffee for free! Check in here there was a special for a dollar off their new drink so that was pretty cool :)
author: Diane S.

description:
After dropping off my niece at the Downtown Campus of City College (4th and Mission), my usual coffeehouse (Organic Coffeehouse) was unexpectedly crowded in the morning. Usually it is not crowded at 10 am, but my caffeine craving will have to settle elsewhere.

I refuse to go to any Starbucks for coffee, due to numerous prior incidents (fights,baristas spit in my drinks,fondle myself, indescent exposure...)at other Starbuck's locations in the past. My colleague told me a new Peet's that just opened up recently. It is located at the corner at 3rd and Mission, not far from the Yelp's headquarter. 

The coffee was good, bearing in mind that I infrequently go to Peet's for coffee. I buy their bagged coffee beans from a supermarket and make my own coffee from my crib. It wasn't crowded either, with the dining area empty with some vacant tables available to "Hang" and "Chill"!
author: Matt G.

description:
I want to like Peet's. I've given them many chances, visiting multiple locations, multiple times. But there is too much competition in San Francisco to put up with a coffee house that doesn't quite cut it for me.

The coffee is fine. I have no complaints in that department. But I'd make it at home if that was all that mattered. I go to a coffee house for service, wifi, snacks and ambiance. In that order (good coffee is assumed.)

The service varies by location & day, is generally OK, but not even on the same planet as Philz. The snacks and ambiance are barely adequate (no bathroom at 3rd & Mission, no mints either, and seating is stingy.)

My biggest gripe with Peet's is the abysmal wifi. Not only do they do the nit-picky, get-a-number-from-the-cashier routine, and then make sure you know that it's only good for one hour, but the signal sucks! Nine times out of ten, I could not get online at all. One time an employee at the Laurel Village location told me I should (get up from my table and) "go stand in the back stairwell - the signal is stronger there." At the 3rd & Mission location I was told on three separate occasions that they had no clue what the problem could be, "it was working a little while ago."

In both cases, I walked one block to Starbucks and, even out on the sidewalk, I'm online before I open my device. Philz wifi rocks, so does almost every other coffee shop in SF. So I regret to say, Peet's is my last choice for coffee in this town, unless I'm getting it to go.
author: Anna L. C.

description: Conveniently located around the block from the Westin, I quickly stopped in on my way to my destination.  The customer service was really good, they made the coffee very quickly, and it was delicious.  The best part, when I checked in on yelp, they hooked me up with a coupon!  Totally rad.
author: Roxana K.

description:
Located at the corner of 3rd & Mission close to three bus stops this Peet's is always busy - especially every morning.  The crew is always friendly and order is made very fast. 

I try to limit my Peet's visits to once a day, but sometimes find myself visiting again in the afternoon.  Thanks!
author: Rich W.

description:
Peets vs Starbucks is like Nordstroms vs Macys. 

Good God I love this location in general just because everyone is so nice and helpful. They all seem to love their jobs and their infectious energy makes me almost not need to buy coffee. I can write a long list of how they did a great job.. but you should just go in for yourself and get a first hand experience.
author: A W.

description:
It's so weird--there are 64 reviews for the 680 Mission St Peet's location--some as recent as this month--and only one, 5-month old review for this, the 692 Mission St location... and the 680 Mission location *does* *not* *exist.*  Peet's website doesn't think so, and the luxury apartment rentals at 680 Mission St probably doesn't think so, either.

Well... whatever.

Peet's coffee is remarkably consistent between locations--I suppose this is a sign that they are becoming more and more chain-like in their operations, which is unfortunately a reason that more and more I will have to stop patronizing them, since I, as a contrary animal and a violent opponent of homogenized retail and food, prefer to "shop and spend" locally.

In any event, this location isn't anywhere near anything I like to do, but when I'm feeling like I've been... "calorically irresponsible..." I will disembark at Embarcadero BART (rather than Civic Center) and walk to work (up around 11th and Mission), and when I do, I'll often stop off here and grab a little pick me up.

This past weekend, a friend was in town and she and I hung out around downtown.  Due to the unseasonably balmy weather--scratch that, due to the downright fucking weirdly warm and humid weather, we sought out something a little chilly and invigorating, and went for some iced coffee.

Peet's makes a damn good brew.  I'll tell you that.  Turnover at this location is a little higher than my usual spot near the Opera house, but the folks that stop through on the trajectory of their professional lives are cheery enough, and turn customers over efficiently and with a mostly believable smile.  It's great coffee, and the prices are right.
author: Martin W.

description: This place gets overshadowed by the grove and how delicious the grove is, but i walked into a place that made me a pretty decent cup of coffee so hey it did its job
author: Jeremy R.

description:
This Peets got me addicted to Peppermint Hot Cocoa. Enough said.

The verdict: By far this location has the best PHC among Peets and it's weird because when I visited the Peets in South Sac, the PHC was a lot sweeter than this location, but I like this one the most =]
author: Natalie G.

description:
Peet's Coffee & Tea at 3rd and Mission is a good place to be. Why?

The People and the Product:
1. Friendly staff that work well together and make you feel welcome.
2. Competent staff with baristas that make a mean White Chocolate Mocha. If you like your espresso based drinks with a bit of that espresso kick, then you will enjoy a trip to this Peet's.
3. The vegan ginger cookie is perfect company for your drink. Great texture and balanced spices make this a delicious treat, so good you won't even notice it's vegan.

Community Support:
4. This Peet's has supported me consistently over the past few years in my efforts to raise money for the San Francisco AIDS Foundation and raise awareness about HIV/AIDS. 
5. Even better, they continue to give back to their community by supporting other great causes.

Selection of Premium Beans:
6. Every week they get a shipment of 100% Kona Reserve. It is a medium roast that, when pressed, produces a distinctly smooth, buttery flavored cup of bliss and,
7. There is rumor that they will once again stock Jamaican Blue Mountain coffee this year.

So the next time you find yourself in the Yerba Buena Arts District and you're in the mood for a snack or running low on coffee at home, stop by Peet's at 3rd and Mission. Good people, good coffee, a good thing.
author: Paul W.

description:
i'm reviewing the service, not the coffee because unless you live in a cave somewhere in another galaxy, then you know peet's coffee is strong like tar...the way i like it.

so, i appreciate the perky and friendly morning crew because yours truly isn't always the most upbeat at 645AM.  

i'm sorry i don't know any of your names, but dude with the fro, thank you for being so "on it" that one ungodly early saturday morning when i was fueling up before helping a friend move.  you obviously noticed my irritation that someone else was too busy talking about songs than to move the line along.  plus, because you are in such a good mood all the time, i can't help but crack a smile.

aside from dude with the fro, thank you M-F morning crew for remembering my medium in a large cup and successfully convincing me to get a pastry.

see you in the morning! :)
author: Sally T.

description: I love this Peet's Coffee! I work early and the staff here is always so nice. It's a good way to start the day being greeted with smiles! One morning I accidentally left my bag that had my lunches for the week in there and they kindly stored it in the refrigerator until I could pick it up later that day. Now that is stellar service!
author: Allison S.

description:
Great coffee and tea - just like all the other Peet's Coffee & Tea stores. Have been here a couple of times for work related meetings or just to grab a drink and head to the park by the Metreon or the Contemporary Jewish Museum seating area. 

Went there yesterday on a date (I like hot chocolate, Mmm'kay! and its been a while), and the hot chocolate AND the date were refreshing, warm, comforting and sweet. :)

1. Staff are very friendly, service is quick and the store is located on a nice corner of downtown with great views. 

2. All the drinks are the usual Peet's Coffee & Tea fare - made well, rich and flavorful... what one has come to expect of Peet's.

3. GREAT location for sight seeing i.e. in the hour and a half that we sat outside, we got a good view of urban life in all its glory - folks heading home, dogs being taken out for walks, folks shopping, running, walking, sleeping, homeless dude with a bad headache, homeless lady talking to her self,  a semi-famous porn star, guy in yellow shorts,... like I said, great location to watch the world. Funny at times, entertaining at times and humbling at times.

4. Only caveat with the store is that seating inside is a bit limited (4 tables at the most) but they have outdoor seating that makes up for it, I guess. 

5. We did debate the pros and cons of heaving outdoor heat lamps since by around 7PM, we started to get cold.. but it was nixed in favor of putting our hands in our pockets and not leaving a carbon foot print!

Good Peet's Coffee & Tea!
author: Amit S.

description:
A neighborhood gem - terrific service, ambient classical music, and a complimentary cup of joe w/ every 1 lb purchase of ground/whole beans.  They have saved me on weekends and holidays when I've been lazy and not planned ahead.  

Thank you everyone at Peete's!
author: Jennifer P.

description: Great place just a hop, skip and a jump from the office. Super friendly, zippy staff, strong coffee and tasty pastries. One star off for the bad line feng shui; knowing where to stand or line up seems like one thing that should be intuitive in any business -- not always the case here. But splitting hairs there. Place is great.
author: Julio A.

description:
I'm on a roll, so here it goes.

This location is near my church, so I come in almost all the time after mass. It's the smallest Peet's that I've been in and you might as well be sitting on the person's lap who's sitting at one of the tables near the bar. Seriously, your ass is in their face while your standing near the bar waiting for your drink...LOL! Um, sorry, inappropriate. So the review. Like I said, this location is small and the staff is really friendly and sweet. I've only been disappointed once with my drink here. It was when I first started drinking their Matcha GT Freddo. It was my first time ordering it at this location and second time drinking it. This drink was strong and bitter. It lacked the soy milk and it was NOT creamy like the first time I ordered a GT Freddo at the O.P. location. Needless to say, I was disappointed and drank it still and didn't bother going back to have them make it right. I was in a hurry to get to my appointment, but other than this "disappointment," all the other subsequent drinks I've ordered from here have been excellent. I've stopped here before on weekdays too before going to a Wednesday afternoon Giants game. There's outdoor seating too, but can get a bit chilly in the late afternoon if you're out their sitting at one of the tables. Um, no bathroom at this location. Too small.
author: Neni E.

description:
Updated 3/21/2007: Man, WTF!!!

This is what happened, step by step.

1) I walk up and order my small coffee. It's 1.65 i give her 2.00 - she doesn't give me change, ok, whatever, i was gonna throw it in their tip jar anyway.
2) They're out of coffee, she says coffee will take 30 seconds, I say ok, that's fine thanks and I wait.
3) The people after me get their coffee.
4) WTF - okay maybe those people ordered decaf.
5) Same girl that i paid oh 3 minutes ago asks me if I have been helped... ???
6) WTF!!
7) I tell her I had a small coffee.
8) WAS SHE FOR REAL?
9) O
10) M
11) G.

Good coffee, but COME ON.

Original review:

I saw Dave Chappelle here with all the other Yelp Staffers. My hands were sticky so i didn't shake his... hope he didn't think I was rude.

Oh, and I ordered a Vanilla Freddo so it didn't seem like I walked all the way from the office to Peet's just to see Dave and his all girl crew. The Freddo was great, it was crunchy, the crunchiest drink ever! Beats Starbuck's anyday. Trust.
author: Richard T.

description:
I'm usually half awake when I walk in here in the morning for my coffee... groggy-eyed and dishelved... but the people are usually always so nice... I knew if I had to wake up at 3:30am every morning to open this place up, I wouldn't be in the best of moods...

The service is usually quite fast... although as a disclaimer ... I rarely order the espresso drinks... I also like getting the pumpkin bread sometimes..  its freakin good

I really like the coffee here... very rich, strong, and fresh... (which is coincidentally the description of the kind of man I'm looking to meet, jk)
...definitely prefer it over starbucks... I agree with a previous post that it can be a little inconvienent to have to wait for a new batch to brew when you're in a rush, but then again, there's a price to pay for freshness...

someday I aspire to be the customer of the week... but I know its never going to happen, alas
author: Ryan K.

description:
Dear Otherwise Totally Pleasant Girl Taking My Order,

Please don't speak in a fake Shakespearean voice before I've had my coffee and I am hungover as hell. It is not cute. It is not funny. And nobody is buying your Queen Gruoch of Scotland or Lady Macbeth routine. Thou roguish rump-fed bum-bailey!

Sincerely,
Bitter Betty
author: Stephy S.

description:
Thank you for beating out Starbucks for the coveted title of "The closest coffee shop to my work".

I can now drink my coffee and actually tolerate it.
author: Drue C.

description:
The problem with working in the Yelperhood is that the First to Review honor is extremely difficult to nab on new businesses. I like Bob, so kudos to you for getting this one ;) 

This new Peet's on the corner of 3rd and Mission is between my walk from Jessie Square Garage to my office, which is more convenient than the one on 2nd & Mission - go figure. Good spot for people watching - sit by the window and you're bound to see someone you know walk by.
author: Connie C.

description:
Nice kids work here. They serve Peet's coffee. Today after asking me for my name a kid who has only served me once before said, "Of course, I should've remembered that." . Nice one my dude. In went a dolla to the almighty jar.

Also, one day I came in here and there were no fewer than three cute girls behind the counter, all wearing glasses. This phenomena, when joined with my coffee experience is Agent J Kryptonite. I'm surprised I remembered my own name, much less my drink order. The heart stops, it rushes, stops again, repeat, etc. Just today my mocha was made by one such Barrista Scientist. When I order a mocha, it mean "times is tough/hangover". It's not just a maintenence level caffeine dosage, it's all-out Mood Mayhem and I need Coffee, and I need Chocolate. Stat.

The Peet's of my youth was such a cultural oasis that the modern version often seems rightfully more corporate by comparison. But it still smells the same.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
Dear Peet's,

Thank you for being there for me when I needed you the other morning. Your perfect cup of coffee was just what I needed to prepare me for a day of shopping in the city. Your baristas were friendly and efficient. Your line was non-existent. Your outdoor seating was comfortable as I sipped on my java, inhaling the carcinogens from the car emissions outside and the second-hand smoke next to me.

Sincerely yours,
Anastasia B.
author: Anastasia B.

description:
I'm going four stars. The staff are friendly and decently consistent while dealing quickly with a ton of customers. Anyone that comes here is lucky. If you go to some of the Peet's in the suburbs they are NOT like this one and you might wait forever to get a sloppily made drink even if you're the only person in the place. In the grand scheme of Peet's Coffee, this location rates near the top.

Somewhat embarrassingly, I'm on track to spend over $500/yr at this place which probably means I need to start drinking more free coffee at the office.
author: Aaron V.

description:
I may not be a first review squatter (please see Bob G's review), but I did go to this new Peet's on its first day of business. While I will say it's nice to have this location just a block from our office, there already is one just 2 blocks away.

For anyone who says that Peet's doesn't want to emulate Starbucks, here's some proof of being on every corner. 

Four stars because I do like their coffee, but I have to admit they don't do anything for the coffee cafe lifestyle! Where are the co-branded cds, I ask? Oh, it is cool that they have a couple of seats inside, plus outdoor tables, but no wireless? Come on, Peet, you can do better, I mean you charge me $1.75 for a medium coffee.
author: Nish N.

description:
I usually come here instead of Starbucks around the block if I have 10 minutes to pick up breakfast, or have a long tea break. It's a fairly small shop comparing with other Peet's and people are always getting confused with where the line is. Sometimes the service is so slow that patrons are lining up outside the door!

I never quite understand how people want to sit outside in this busy street, breathing in  the carbon monoxide while having a cup of coffee, with the constant traffic as well as the honking of the firetrucks.

But then the coffee is so great that all others imperfections seem minute...
author: T L.

description: Lately my love has gone out to their Raspberry Mocha -- so here's to this location always preparing it right, regardless of how busy they are.
author: Shauna S.

description: Door was unlocked I walked in for espresso. Staff member says he was just about to lock the door. Closed at 8. Might have been 1 minute after. Jackass poked his head out of the door after I left to ask what I wanted. I left. They must not need my business every Wednesday night for the next two years while I take classes right next door.  No worries, I'll find another coffee place close by.
author: Brian L.

description:
Man!!  I take a few days off walking to work my 'usual' way and freiken BOB 'the other yelper' beat me to this!  ;)

I like the layout - the coffee is divine and I can open this door faster - FANTASTIC!! That's about all I need to be happy here..

But does anyone ever notice that Peet's hires the BEST people ever?  I always keep to myself when shopping or dining (if you can believe it) but I always get into the nicest random conversations with these kids!!

Sometimes they even give me the coffee for free!! (I'm a good tipper..;))
author: Yelper A.

description:
So i like to switch off my coffee places... because... i dont know, i just do. At the same time, I don't like to stray more than a few blocks from school.
The staff at this new Peets is so much nicer than the Peets on Mission & 3rd. It's untapped, fresh and clean. Best of all, no line! No pressure when ordering my sugar-free vanilla soy latte. Oh, and they said my name like 5 times... looks like I could be a regular soon!
author: Nicole L.

description:
Great coffee.  Very good staff. If I had one concern it is that the rope in the middle of the waiting area seems to be there just for the sake of confusion, such that confusion ensues as to where the line starts, and whether other people are waiting ahead of you to order, or are they just milling about on either side of the rope.  The staff do a good job of mediating who's waiting to order, and just holla out for you to step forward to get you taken care of.  Couldn't we just lose the rope?

Peet's does a very good job with pastries as well, and when they don't have my preferred pastry, I'll run down the other end of the block and pick one up at Tart to Tart.  Peet's beats T2T though because their coffee rocks hard.
author: Danny H.

description: This place is usually busy and crowded. :) it's located quite close to an International language school so you can often see students practicing English with their fellow students or just people which is kinda neat. It's a cool place but usually hard to find a table/chair if you want to sit down. :)
author: Claire Y.

description: I normally favor mom & pop coffee shops over large chains, but Peet's brews delicious coffee. This branch in particular has very friendly staff, especially during the mornings.
author: Noelle D.

description:
Ahh... Peet's in the morning!  I've been coming to this Peet's almost every morning for over a year now and it has saved my life many-a-day.  

The morning crew is great.  Always cheerful, even when I am reeling from night of debauchery...
The coffee is outstanding...
Seating sucks... on that note, Yerba Buena park is located on the opposite corner, an ideal location to enjoy caffeine and shoot the breeze.

One of the best locations to get coffee in the hood.
author: David M.

description:
A five-star review on a chain coffee joint? Yes, totally warranted for about a thousand reasons. Simply put, this particular Peet's has the soul of an indie coffee house, minus even an ounce of pretension. Vanessa & Marie & Gio are my homies. Several months ago, they started noticing that I wear ugly ties every Friday (for my intra-office ugly tie competition, of course), & asked what I thought about them having an in-store competition.
